description: Validates general rules and pages following slide 2

rules.rule_text: If retail document: include retail disclaimers
rules.detailed_description: Documents intended for retail (non-professional) clients must mandatorily contain the following legal mentions: 'Capital at risk' (warning that capital may decrease) and 'Past performance is no guarantee of future performance' (disclaimer on historical performance). These warnings must be visible, in bold, and in the same font as the main text.
violation_examples: Retail document without 'Capital at risk' mention
Absence of the disclaimer 'Past performance is no guarantee of future performance'
Missing warnings for non-professional clients

rules.rule_text: If professional document: include professional disclaimers
rules.detailed_description: Documents intended for professional investors must contain disclaimers specific to professionals. The document must clearly indicate: 'Document reserved for professional investors' or 'This document is intended exclusively for professional clients'. The warnings must mention the professional nature of the communication.
violation_examples: Professional document without mention 'reserved for professional investors'
Absence of indication of the professional status of the recipient
Retail disclaimers used in a professional document

rules.rule_text: Studies/numerical data/graphics etc. must include a reference (footnote) specifying at minimum the source and the date
rules.detailed_description: Any numerical data, statistic, graph, performance table, market study or quantitative analysis must be accompanied by a source citation with date. Recommended format: 'Source: ODDO BHF Asset Management, as of 31/12/2024' or 'Source: Bloomberg, December 2024'. Performances, rates, percentages, indices must all have a source and date.
violation_examples: Performance of +15% without indication of source or date
Graph without mention 'Source: ..., as of ...'
Market data without citation of origin
Statistics presented without temporal reference

rules.rule_text: For each fund presented: mandatory mention of the SRI with the associated disclaimer on the same slide
rules.detailed_description: Each fund presentation must include the SRI (Synthetic Risk Indicator) on a scale of 1 to 7, accompanied by the explanatory disclaimer. Required format: 'SRI: X/7' followed by 'A synthetic risk indicator of X indicates a [low/moderate/high] risk level'. The SRI and its explanation must appear on the same slide as the fund presentation.
violation_examples: Fund presented without mention of the SRI
SRI indicated without the explanatory disclaimer
SRI disclaimer on a different slide from the fund presentation
Risk indicator absent from the presentation

rules.rule_text: For retail presentations: include a Glossary of technical terms at the end of the presentation and ensure these terms appear in the document
rules.detailed_description: Retail documents must contain a glossary at the end of the presentation defining all technical terms used. Terms requiring definition: SRI, duration, alpha, beta, volatility, tracking error, derivatives, hedging, momentum, stockpicking, small caps, ISIN, SRRI, ESG, etc. Each technical term in the document must have its explanation in the glossary.
violation_examples: Retail document using 'alpha' and 'tracking error' without glossary
Technical terms (momentum, derivatives) undefined
Glossary absent in a retail presentation
Terms from the document absent from the glossary

rules.rule_text: Risk warnings/disclaimers must be in bold
rules.detailed_description: All warnings and disclaimers relating to risks must be formatted in bold. This includes: 'Capital at risk', 'Past performance is no guarantee of future performance', SRI disclaimers, warnings on volatility, mentions of risk of capital loss. Bold formatting must be applied to the entire warning sentence.
violation_examples: Disclaimer 'Capital at risk' in normal text instead of bold
Risk warnings without bold formatting
Risk mentions not typographically highlighted

rules.rule_text: Risk warnings/disclaimers must use the same font and size as the main text
rules.detailed_description: Disclaimers and warnings must use the same font and the same size as the main body text. They must not be reduced in small characters or placed in a different font. Prohibition of putting warnings in smaller font to make them less visible.
violation_examples: Disclaimers in size 8 while main text is size 12
Warnings in a different font from the rest of the document
Risk mentions reduced in small characters

rules.rule_text: Risk warnings/disclaimers must be visible (not in footnotes)
rules.detailed_description: Risk warnings must be clearly visible in the main body of the text. They must not be relegated to footnotes, small-sized footers, or appendices. Critical disclaimers ('Capital at risk', 'Past performance') must appear prominently in the main text.
violation_examples: Disclaimer 'Capital at risk' relegated to page footer
Warnings only in footnotes
Risks mentioned in small characters at the end of the document
Disclaimers in an appendix instead of the main body

rules.rule_text: Opinions and assumptions must be softened: E.g.: "according to our opinion", "according to our analyses", "the fund aims to…"
rules.detailed_description: Any opinion, forecast, assumption or statement about markets must be nuanced with softened formulations. Use: 'according to our analysis', 'according to our opinion', 'we think that', 'the fund aims to', 'we estimate that'. Prohibition of assertive language: 'the fund will', 'markets will be', 'this strategy beats', 'we guarantee', 'guaranteed success'.
violation_examples: The fund will outperform the market (language too assertive)
This strategy beats all its competitors (un-nuanced statement)
Markets will explode in 2025 (forecast without softening)
Guaranteed success, assured performance (prohibited promises)

rules.rule_text: The fund strategy must be presented in accordance with legal documentation: investment thresholds by asset class, strategy, geographic allocation, minimum ticket, etc.
rules.detailed_description: All information on the fund strategy must correspond exactly to the legal documentation (prospectus, DICI/KID). This includes: exposure percentages (e.g. 60-100% equities), geographic area (Europe, World), authorized asset classes, minimum investment ticket, recommended investment horizon, use of derivative instruments. No divergence is tolerated between the commercial document and the prospectus.
violation_examples: Presentation indicates '50-70% equities' while prospectus says '60-100%'
Geographic area different from that in the prospectus
Strategy described differently from legal documentation
Minimum ticket not compliant with prospectus

rules.rule_text: Internal limits (set by the risk committee or risk control) must not appear in any presentation as they are non-contractual
rules.detailed_description: Internal management limits, set by the risk committee or internal control, are confidential and non-contractual. Never mention: internal VaR limits, internal concentration thresholds, internal liquidity constraints, internal hedging rules. Only regulatory and prospectus limits are communicable.
violation_examples: Mention of an 'internal VaR limit of 5%'
Indication of internal concentration thresholds
Reference to constraints from the risk committee
Disclosure of internal management rules

rules.rule_text: Avoid anglicisms in retail presentations, or define them (footnotes or glossary with reference)
rules.detailed_description: Retail presentations must prioritize French. English terms (stockpicking, momentum, tracking error, alpha, beta, hedge, leverage, small caps) must either be translated or defined in a glossary with reference. If an anglicism is used, add an explanatory note in French.
violation_examples: Use of 'stockpicking' without definition in a retail document
Terms 'momentum' and 'alpha' neither translated nor defined
Multiple anglicisms without explanatory glossary
Retail document with untranslated English vocabulary

rules.rule_text: Commercial documents relating to strategies are reserved for professional clients only → include the professional disclaimer
rules.detailed_description: Any investment strategy presentation (not linked to a specific UCITS fund) is exclusively intended for professional investors. These documents must mandatorily mention: 'Document reserved for professional investors' or 'This document is intended exclusively for professional clients'. Strategies cannot be presented to retail clients.
violation_examples: Strategy presentation without professional disclaimer
Strategy document targeting retail clients
Absence of mention 'reserved for professionals' on a strategy
Strategy presented without audience restriction

rules.rule_text: No confusion between the presentation of a strategy and that of a fund in the same document
rules.detailed_description: A document must clearly distinguish whether it presents a specific UCITS fund (with ISIN, prospectus, DICI) or a general investment strategy. Do not mix the two in the same document. If presenting a fund, provide its legal characteristics. If presenting a strategy, indicate that it is a general approach without reference to a specific product.
violation_examples: Document mixing fund presentation and general strategy
ISIN mentioned in a strategy presentation
Legal characteristics of a fund in a strategy document
Ambiguity between general approach and specific product

rules.rule_text: For Belgium: if presentation intended for Belgian non-professional clients, ensure prior validation by the FSMA
rules.detailed_description: Any retail document intended for non-professional clients in Belgium must be validated by the FSMA (Financial Services and Markets Authority) before distribution. Verify that the document has received FSMA approval. Recommended mention: 'Document validated by the FSMA' or 'This document has received FSMA approval'. Without FSMA validation, the document cannot be distributed to Belgian retail clients.
violation_examples: Retail document for Belgium without FSMA validation
Absence of mention of FSMA approval for Belgian clients
Distribution in Belgium without prior authorization
Document not validated by the Belgian authority

rules.rule_text: Avoid mentioning other funds (Oddo or others) in a standard presentation of a fund unless it is a range presentation
rules.detailed_description: A presentation dedicated to a specific fund must not mention other funds (ODDO BHF or competitors) unless it is a multi-fund range presentation. Avoid comparisons with other funds, references to other products, or mentions of similar funds. Each fund presentation must be standalone.
violation_examples: Fund presentation mentioning 'see also our XYZ fund'
Comparison with other ODDO BHF funds
Reference to competitor funds in a single-fund presentation
List of other products in a standard fund sheet

rules.rule_text: Do not say that an ETF is liquid
rules.detailed_description: It is prohibited to state that an ETF is liquid or has guaranteed liquidity. ETF liquidity depends on multiple factors (trading volume, underlying market, market maker). Avoid formulations: 'liquid ETF', 'high liquidity', 'easy to buy/sell'. Prefer: 'ETF listed on exchange', 'tradable on exchange'.
violation_examples: Document states 'this ETF is very liquid'
Mention of 'guaranteed liquidity' for an ETF
Statement 'easily sellable at any time'
Promise of liquidity for an ETF

rules.rule_text: If two documents are versions of the same text but in different languages, the alignment between the meaning of each sentence and the data must be exact and consistent. Each sentence in one language must convey precisely the same information, intentions and nuances as its equivalent in the other language. No addition, omission or modification of meaning is permitted.
rules.detailed_description: For multilingual documents (French version and English/German/etc. version), consistency between versions is mandatory. Each sentence, numerical data, disclaimer, date, percentage must be identical in all versions. Translations must be faithful without addition or omission. Verify that: identical performances, faithfully translated disclaimers, matching dates, identical numerical data.
violation_examples: French version indicates +15% but English version +16%
Disclaimer present in French but absent in English
Different dates between language versions
Addition of information in one version that does not exist in the other

rules.rule_text: Never start a presentation with performance: start at minimum with the fund presentation
rules.detailed_description: The document structure must start with the fund presentation (objective, strategy, characteristics) BEFORE presenting performances. Prohibition of placing performances (return figures, performance graphs) on the first slide or before the complete fund presentation. Recommended order: 1) Fund presentation, 2) Strategy, 3) Management team, 4) Performance.
violation_examples: Document starts with 'Performance +25% in 2024' before any presentation
First slide shows a performance graph
Performance presented before the fund objective
Returns displayed from the start without context

rules.rule_text: The Morningstar Rating must be accompanied (if it exists) by the calculation date
rules.detailed_description: If a Morningstar rating (stars) is mentioned, it must mandatorily be accompanied by its calculation date. Recommended format: 'Morningstar Rating: ★★★★ (4 stars as of 31/12/2024)' or '★★★★★ - 5 Morningstar stars, December 2024'. Without date, the rating is not valid as it can change monthly.
violation_examples: Morningstar 5-star rating without indication of date
Mention '★★★★' without specifying 'as of 31/12/2024'
Morningstar rating without reference date
Morningstar stars displayed without temporal context

rules.rule_text: The Morningstar Rating must be accompanied (if it exists) by the reference Morningstar category
rules.detailed_description: The Morningstar rating must mention the reference category used for the ranking. Recommended format: 'Morningstar Rating: ★★★★ in the Europe Equities category' or '5 Morningstar stars - Category: EAA Fund EUR Moderate Allocation'. The category allows understanding the comparison universe.
violation_examples: Morningstar rating without mention of the category
Stars displayed without specifying 'in the Europe Equities category'
Rating without indication of the comparison universe
Isolated Morningstar rating without category context

rules.rule_text: At the end of the presentation: include detailed fund characteristics
rules.detailed_description: The last section of the document must contain a page of detailed fund characteristics including: ISIN, AMF classification, management company, depositary, management fees, entry/exit fees, valuation (daily/weekly), minimum investment, marketing countries, creation date, assets under management. This summary page is mandatory at the end of the presentation.
violation_examples: Presentation without characteristics page at the end of the document
Absence of mention of ISIN, fees, management company in conclusion
Document ending without summary of characteristics
Missing technical information on the last page

rules.rule_text: Indication of the person responsible for validating the presentation, consistent with the general disclaimer and the management company
rules.detailed_description: The document must mention who validated the presentation. Recommended format: 'Document validation: Marketing Department - ODDO BHF Asset Management SAS' or 'Document validated by Marketing Management' or 'Validation responsible: Communication Department - ODDO BHF AM'. This mention must be consistent with the indicated management company and the general disclaimer.
violation_examples: Document without mention of the validation responsible
Absence of indication 'Document validated by...'
Validation not attributed to an identified department
Inconsistency between management company and mentioned validator

rules.rule_text: When presenting a management team, add at the bottom of the page that 'The team is subject to change'
rules.detailed_description: If the document presents the management team (names of managers, analysts, photos, biographies), it must mandatorily include the disclaimer: 'The management team is subject to change' or 'The team composition may evolve' or equivalent formulation. This disclaimer must appear on the same page as the team presentation, ideally in a footnote.
violation_examples: Team presentation without mention 'subject to change'
Manager biographies without disclaimer on possible changes
Management team page without warning of potential change
Manager names displayed without mention of team evolution
